section.para: The types of potential misstatements are

listitem.para: failure to properly document the hedge and the expectation of hedge effectiveness.
the hedge does not remain highly effective on an ongoing basis so that hedge accounting does not continue to be appropriate.
the assessment of hedge effectiveness is not consistent with the risk management strategy documented for the particular hedging relationship.
JLM does not assess hedge effectiveness for similar hedging strategies in a similar manner, and such differences are not documented.
incorrect determination of the fair value of the swap and bonds.
incorrect computation and recording of interest and accrued interest on the bonds.
inadequate financial statement presentation and disclosure.
